CatDescriptText: Madeline Roberson, stock girl, St. Clair Village was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 1, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think that the military strength for defense of the United States is adequate enough like Presidential candidate Richard Nixon declares it is, or do you believe that it is not strong enough, and needs strengthening, like Presidential candidate John Kennedy says it is?" Answer reads: "My point of view is that our country is not as strong as it should be, but we are as strong as we will be for a while, because Russia is so far ahead of us in modern weapons."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Madeline Roberson wearing short sleeve embroidered button down collared shirt, standing with arms crossed at intersection of Smithfield Street and Liberty Avenue, Downtown
